qas.question: In some CPU designs there is tinier computer called what?
A microsequencer can be found in what other computer component?

context: The sequence of operations that the control unit goes through to process an instruction is in itself like a short computer program, and indeed, in some more complex <a1_0>CPU<a1_0/> designs, there is another yet smaller computer called a <a0_0>microsequencer<a0_0/>, which runs a microcode program that causes all of these events to happen.
